channel.title: RS2 IP Bans
channel.description: How often does Fagex throw IP bans around for macrioing? Are there any proxies which have enough speed to play rs? Just wondering.

item.title: RS2 IP Bans
item.dc:creator: @The_Un-Named The Un-Named
item.description:
@The_Un-Named wrote:

It should change your external IP. It should say somthing on your router security log like this: “Client 1 IP change blablabla”.

Read full topic

item.title: RS2 IP Bans
item.dc:creator: @xxlegitxx xxlegitxx
item.description:
@xxlegitxx wrote:

The Un-Named:

WRONG! Resetting a router causes your external IP to change.

I stand corrected. Though I’ve done this multiple times and I dont notice my ip address different. But I’m just comparing from memory, so idk.

Read full topic

item.title: RS2 IP Bans
item.dc:creator: @PaulT PaulT
item.description:
@PaulT wrote:

How often does Fagex throw IP bans around for macrioing?

Very rarely.

Are there any proxies which have enough speed to play rs?

Yes.

Read full topic

item.title: RS2 IP Bans
item.dc:creator: @Mopman Mopman
item.description:
@Mopman wrote:

If you have a dynamic IP, then yes turning your router off and on again will change your IP, because you are reconnecting.
If you have a static IP, then you always have the same one.

Read full topic

item.title: RS2 IP Bans
item.dc:creator: @The_Un-Named The Un-Named
item.description:
@The_Un-Named wrote:

I belive it’s all, although it dose depend on how long you leave your router off. If I turn mine off and back on in less than 10 seconds nothing happens, 5+ minutes and I get a guarenteed external IP change. Also, turning any router off at nights(or when it’s not going to be used for awhile) can stop it overheating.

Read full topic

item.title: RS2 IP Bans
item.dc:creator: @Mopman Mopman
item.description:
@Mopman wrote:

[quote=“The Un-Named, post:12, topic:15982”][quote author=xxlegitxx link=topic=23843.msg268121#msg268121 date=1159080938]
Programs that change my IP address? They cant do that without going to the isp.

Unless you are talking about proxies… Proxies dont get stuck on anything, generally, except for crap speeds. The only thing I can think of that would get stuck on java is a cache.

I dont understand them that well, but this is what a proxy is: Proxies are programs that send your request to a third party server. That server makes the request on rs.com. Then rs replies to the proxy, which then sends the packet back to you. Tor/Vidalia is a packaged proxy program that works like this, but with mega-steroids.
[/quote]

WRONG! Resetting a router causes some people’s external IP to change.[/quote]

Fixed.

Read full topic

item.title: RS2 IP Bans
item.dc:creator: @The_Un-Named The Un-Named
item.description:
@The_Un-Named wrote:

[quote=“xxlegitxx, post:3, topic:15982”]Programs that change my IP address? They cant do that without going to the isp.

Unless you are talking about proxies… Proxies dont get stuck on anything, generally, except for crap speeds. The only thing I can think of that would get stuck on java is a cache.

I dont understand them that well, but this is what a proxy is: Proxies are programs that send your request to a third party server. That server makes the request on rs.com. Then rs replies to the proxy, which then sends the packet back to you. Tor/Vidalia is a packaged proxy program that works like this, but with mega-steroids.[/quote]

WRONG! Resetting a router causes your external IP to change.

Read full topic

item.title: RS2 IP Bans
item.dc:creator: @xxlegitxx xxlegitxx
item.description:
@xxlegitxx wrote:

Programs that change my IP address? They cant do that without going to the isp.

Unless you are talking about proxies… Proxies dont get stuck on anything, generally, except for crap speeds. The only thing I can think of that would get stuck on java is a cache.

I dont understand them that well, but this is what a proxy is: Proxies are programs that send your request to a third party server. That server makes the request on rs.com. Then rs replies to the proxy, which then sends the packet back to you. Tor/Vidalia is a packaged proxy program that works like this, but with mega-steroids.

Read full topic

item.title: RS2 IP Bans
item.dc:creator: @leader leader
item.description:
@leader wrote:

When I used to play, I had about 4 characters who got banned but I didn’t get an IP ban. I doubt any of the website proxy sites will work because they get stuck on the java page. That is the page where it downloads all the updates. There are programs that can change your IP address.

Read full topic
